Summary Heading: Don’t stay at the Sandpiper Motel Costa Mesa
Summary: I had booked this motel for a four night stay thinking it was a good location and decent for the price. I arrived around 11 pm exhausted from the road trip to pull into this motel with homeless people loitering.  We were tired so checked in but asked if we were not happy if we could check out the next day and get refund on remaining nights. The clerk said no problem. To say the least, the room was disgusting. It reeked and the floor felt slimy. The sheets were extremely rough. The bed hard. No room to place toiletries in the bathroom. No room in shower either. A small space in shower for shampoo but it kept falling. There was a demonic image on the tile worked into the design. A couple fought loudly all night. Summary Heading: A great place for the price
Summary: I read reviews on this place before booking here and think many of them are unfair.....firstly what do people expect for $70 a night.....its not the Hilton but then its not $200 a night either. We stayed here for 2 weeks and really enjoyed it, it was clean with OK decor,  flat screen/HBO TV, a fridge comfortable bed, not that noisy concidering its next to the 55...no phone but who needs one these days!!! The staff were mostly friendly and pleasant, the place is so handy to shops and movie theater just down the road....walking distance.....OC fair 5 mins up the road.

This place was the most disgusting motel I've ever stayed in. We arrived late and had reservations for 4 nights. Had I seen the room before checking in, I would have been outta there. The shower had so many repairs with putty and it was filthy! The bathroom window almost fell out and the bedspread was extremely dirty. To me, this place is a 1 or 2 hour f*^@ joint. Believe me, we saw it first hand. My advice to anyone thinking of staying in this rat hole, check the rooms first before paying. They offer no refunds once payment is made.

Summary Heading: It's OK> Just not the  Four Seasons
Summary: Some people have these "standards' and are too finiky. If you are on a budget, it is OK as the rooms have been remodeled. Be sure you get one of those. It is right by Newport Beach Blvd. The owner is a miser who won't pay for anything. I have stayed there several times. The biggest problem is the Wi Fi doesn't reach more tham two doors down from the office. I had to bring my laptop to the office. There it worked fine. No bugs and clean. You are there to sleep period.
Room tip: Remodeled room close to front office for good WiFi reception

Summary Heading: No frills. You get what you pay for.
Summary: I stayed here for one night after attending a friends wedding in Newport beach and was not able to drive home. Just wanted somewhere to lay my head and wouldn't be too costly. The sand piper is exactly that. Old hotel and it looks the part. Plenty of parking and free wifi is nice. Room was pretty worn but for $45 I wasn't expecting anything fancy. They even have smoking rooms still, not too common these days. Again this hotel is nothing fancy and the price reflects that ( actually I'm puzzled as to how they have managed to stay in business.)  I gave the sandpiper a 4 due to my expectations not being very high. Would stay here under similar circumstances again
